fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28628].
  {panel}

It is now possible to move issues between projects.
However, sometimes the reporter of the issue is not "a member" of the target project. He has no "member-rights" or permissions to see or create issues in this project for various reasons.

Our developers sometimes move a support request to an other project in Jira where the reporter is not a member. It should be nice if this possibility could be blocked.

I compare this to the assignable user permission. You can only assign issues to projectmembers if they have this permission. 
When the reporter of the issue does not have the "reporter permission" in the target project, the issue can not be moved to that project.
fields.summary: Block on moving issues when reporter is not a member of the target project
Mapping of old fields to new fields when moving to new project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28624].
  {panel}

Currently we advise a user to go through some steps and is led to one that gets them to do something that isn't useful. In our JIRA044, JIRA050, JIRA051 or JIRA docs:

# They follow the [create a keystore file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-1. CreatetheKeystoreFile] and generate a CSR.
# We ask them to [export the certificate|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-2.ExporttheCertificate] from their keystore.
# We then ask them to [import the certificate into the cacerts trustStore|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-ImportCertificateIntoTheTruststore]. The truststore is designed for certificate authority (CA) certs (e.g.: godaddy/rapidssl/verisign certs) and should mostly have all of the default CA certs. The only time they would need to do this is if the CA is not already loaded or the CA cert is self-signed. Step 1 gets them to sign a standard certificate, not a CA.

We don't need to ask them to do steps 2 & 3 as when the CSR is generated in step 1, it gets automatically imported and by default when Tomcat starts up it will use the keystore generated in step 1 (provided they did it as the correct user). You could remove the section in the attached screenshot as steps 2 and 3 aren't necessary.

We also don't warn the user that when using the keytool, it will default to the user's home directory that is running that command - this could lead to problems if they run it as a user that doesn't execute Tomcat. For example:

# The bundled Linux installer sets up JIRA as the {{jira}} user.
# Tomcat defaults to the {{~jira/.keystore}} file for the user that executes it.
# If a customer generates the keytool as a user other than {{jira}}, it will not put it in {{~jira/.keystore}}, so Tomcat will not have the correct keystore.

Could you please add something in like the below for step 1:

(i) On Linux, please ensure this command is run as the user that Tomcat runs on. By default, this is {{jira}} when using the bundled installer.

And also change "2. Import certificate into the trust store" so that we're clear that the user only needs to do this step if they have a CA certificate that is not already in cacerts.

Please let me know if you need clarification or anything - thanks! :)
fields.summary: Import Certificate into the Trust-store discrepencies between versions
Please update docs for API testing scripts concerning users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28620].
  {panel}

Jira's reliance on cookies for session state causes issues when trying to keep two issue navigators open in separate windows.

Easiest to explain with a reproduction:

1) Open a saved filter.
2) Open a different saved filter in a different tab or window.
3) Sort the first saved filter by clicking on a column header.

Expected result: the contents of the first saved filter is sorted.
Actual result: the contents of the first saved filter are replaced with the sorted contents of the more recent, second saved filter.

SAC issue: JSP-129683
fields.summary: browser based filter searches
Issue Selector from convert to Sub-task screen should display all project issues
Share Content Component in Jira 5 has less functions than in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28617].
  {panel}

Hello team,
We noticed an oddity when we have queries in different tabs on a browser. This happens on any browser and can be easily reproduced by the steps below:

#   Open a browser tab (tab #1) and query (query #1) for issues in Jira
#    Go back to tab #1 and click on an issue
#    Open another browser tab (tab #2) and run a different query (query #2)
#    Click "Return to Search"

* Expected results:
You see the search results from query #1

* Returned results:
You see the search results from query #2

Please let us know if it's indeed a bug or it's an expected behavior on JIRA.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Multiple tabs with different queries cause the "return to query" button to behave differently
Is it possible to ad administrators to Rapid Boards, Dashboards and Filters?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28614].
  {panel}

Hi,

Today, when I'm creating a bug, my bug is in Open status.
However, I would like to have a different status if my bug is assigned to somebody at the creation.
Is it possible to have this behaviour in JIRA?

Steps would be:
1/ Create an issue
2/ assign issue to somebody during the creation
3/ status will be "assigned" after my click on "Create" button
   Moreover, if the assignee is "unassigned", status must be open after my click on "Create" button

Mickael THIEVENT
SILKAN
fields.summary: Status when I'm creating issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28613].
  {panel}

I have tested JIRA version 4.4.3, 4.4.5 and 5.0.5 and found that JIRA throws an error while translating status with if description string exceeds 255 characters.

Step to reproduce:

# Log in as a user with the JIRA Administrators global permission.
# Go to Administration>Statuses
# Add a new status and make it's description more than 255 character
# Click "Translate"
# Copy Status name and description set and paste to the relevant Name and Description text field
# Select any Language from "View Language Translations", click Update
# JIRA will throw an error as the attached 'Error translating status.png'
fields.summary: Error Translating Issue Status with more than 255 characters of description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28599].
  {panel}

We have a geographically disperse development organization that consists of smaller self-contained development groups.  The smaller groups have the latitude to use different development life cycle methods.  For instance, one organization uses a waterfall methodology, while another uses scrum.  

Despite having these various methodologies, we wish to have a single issue tracking system because we have a single overarching CM and QA organization.  While this may not seem ideal, it fits us well because we have different delivery models (some are customer oriented and necessitate a waterfall, others are product oriented and can successfully use scrum).  

Our request is to allow JIRA and GreenHopper to have different licenses counts.  It's frustrating (and a waste of money) to us to have to license GreenHopper at the same level as JIRA, when only a percentage of the GreenHopper licenses will actually be used.  

It's a testament to how we like JIRA as a bug tracker that we are considering making the move to it organizationally.  However, because the perception is that we are wasting money on GreenHopper licenses, it may sway our decision making otherwise (at least in the form of deciding on a scrum product).
fields.summary: Configure GreenHopper to have different number of licenses than JIRA
Improve backup manager

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28561].
  {panel}

According to the [REST API documentation|http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id165489]:
{noformat}
Create a version via POST.

acceptable request representations:

application/json [collapse]
Example
{
    "description": "An excellent version",
    "name": "New Version 1",
    "userReleaseDate": "5/Jul/2010",
    "project": "PXA",
    "releaseDate": "2010-07-05",
    "released": true,
    "archived": false
}
available response representations:

201 - application/json [collapse]
Example
{
    "description": "An excellent version",
    "name": "New Version 1",
    "userReleaseDate": "5/Jul/2010",
    "project": "PXA",
    "releaseDate": "2010-07-05",
    "released": true,
    "archived": false
}
Returned if the version is created successfully.
{noformat}
the example data for POST request has both "userReleaseDate" and "releaseDate".

I have tested that we just need to specify one from the "userReleaseDate" or "releaseDate" or it will fail. The "released" and "archived" is not working also so we should remove it from the example.

By the way, the example response is not correct also.
fields.summary: Update code example in auto-generated REST API documentation - requires an update to JIRA's source code.
labels should be case insensitive

As long any change / publish of a worflow you might create a backup as well before activating it.
Unfortunately, it isn't possible to "publish" an old backup as like a draft if something went wrong in the WF change.
Reactivating an old Workflow backup might be very painful atm. and needs to change the Workflow-Schemes as well! That's a pity.

Can you please handle "Workflow Backups" as like Drafts which might be "published"?!
This will also fix the lack of usability in the Workflow-View where (many) backups clutter the screen layout.

The maximal goal is sorting users by any login info (first/last login date, number of failed attempts etc.)

The minimal goal is finding all users whose last login was, say, a month ago.
The minimal solution could be any of:

1) sorting all users by Last (login) date in the Users list (ascending/descending order)
2) using a filter by the last login date with condition (equal, less than etc.)
3) generating an administrative report

BR,
Ivan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28549].
  {panel}

The root of the problem is that JIRA's searchService returns results by matching individual strings and not by phrase.  This is problematic especially when using JIRA's autocomplete function for filters.  If the results returned does not show the intended filter within the dropdown, then JIRA will not recognize the filter.

h5. The problem:
* Field searches that use autocomplete only recognizes a filter if it shows up in the dropdown. Specifying a full filter name, does not work if it is not in dropdown list
* JIRA's searchService returns results based on individual string searches and not by phrase, thus causing the first point i made above.

My full analysis is found within a customer's support ticket here:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-128804?focusedCommentId=2646691&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2646691

As it contained some potentially private information in the screenshots, I'll not be posting it over here.  I also want to stress that I have reproduced the issue with a vanilla instance where I scripted to have a ton of filters.
fields.summary: JIRA is unable to properly handle searches with a massive number of filters
Allow stories to aggregate issues from multiple projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28545].
  {panel}

When an anonymous user is creating a ticket and tries to attach a file to it, it gets the following error message:
_Cannot attach file: Unknown server error (404)._

The network response message is the following:
_No project could be found with id '10103'._

This happens because in the project permissions, although the group 'Anyone' has permissions to 'Create Issues' and 'Add Attachments', it does not have permissions to 'Browse Projects'.

Unless there is a workaround, it seems that this functionality to add attachments anonymously is missing.

h3. Variants
It seems that the project could not be found error will be thrown to users without system administrators permission and it is misleading since the real issue is about having _Browse Project_ permission.
Users with system administrator(Global Permission) permission will receive:
_Cannot attach file <filename>: You must have the browse project permission to view this project._
fields.summary: Anonymous and licensed users cannot attach a file while creating a ticket unless they have 'Browse Projects' permissions
Upgrade JIRA Suite Utilities to 1.3.0 in JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28540].
  {panel}

Currently the integrity checker is a bit unloved. There's a number of things it does, but just as many things it doesn't quite do. Ideally, we'd like it to be able to what it does now, but with a bit more understanding behind it. Things like:

* Check for corrupt / invalid filters
* Check for screens / field configs referencing fields that don't exist anymore
* Check for workflow integrity 

Most important of all however, is the need to document the feature and the things it does. Currently I don't know enough about it to trust it will find valid results and fix them.
fields.summary: Revamp the Integrity Checker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28519].
  {panel}

Since JIRA 5.0.3 comment length can be limited by using the {{jira.text.field.character.limit}} property (see JRA-27668). However, it is still possible to crash JIRA by adding many comments to an issue (or when the limit is disabled, which is the default).

Steps to reproduce:
* Create a huge issue by adding lots of large comments or a large number of comments
* open the issue in the browser, clicking "Refresh" a few times so that it's being loaded in several parallel requests
* JIRA will crash with OutOfMemoryException

We need to be able to handle large issues like this. Some options for fixing that come to mind:
* only rendering the first N comments (where N may vary depending on the comment limit)
* calculate the size of the comments before loading them into memory, and do something different depending on whether they are above or below a certain threshold

Those are just 2 of many possible options. The important thing is that JIRA doesn't crash, and that we handle both dimensions (comment size and number of comments).

h3. Resolution - JIRA 6.4 and above

h4. For JIRA 6.4.x customers

All the code changes to support the limit throughout JIRA will be included in JIRA 6.4.1. 

However, the limit is still off by default, customers wishing to enforce the limit can manually set the {{jira.text.field.character.limit}} advanced setting. We recommend to set the value to 32767 which will be new default from JIRA 7.0 and onwards.

h4. For JIRA 7.0 and Cloud customers

All the code changes to support the limit throughout JIRA will be included in the next Cloud release and JIRA 7.0

{{jira.text.field.character.limit}} *will be set to 32767 by default* unless you have explicitly changed this setting to a different value.

h3. Workaround

Extract large comments and set jira.text.field.character.limit.
Please see our [OutOfMemoryError Caused by Large Comments or Descriptions in an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/OutOfMemoryError+Caused+by+Large+Comments+or+Descriptions+in+an+Issue] KB for further information on this.
fields.summary: JIRA dies with OutOfMemoryException when rendering issues with numerous and/or large comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28496].
  {panel}

JIRA should follow this algoritm while trying to decide which language to display:

- User has a specific language selected on its profile use that one.
- If not, read the "Accept-Language" header and if that language doesn't match with the server default language, and we have a translation available for that language, select this one (this selection should *NOT* be persisted on the user profile).
- If none of the above, fallback to the Server default language setting.

http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.4
http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-accept-lang-locales

{quote}
As most of our customers are from Germany, we've set up the 'Default Language' to german.
Registered user can change that in their profile if wanted. That's fine.

We've now also got a 'public' project, which is often visited by international users.
As being 'public' the visitors don't (usually) have an account, therefore they can't override the language defaults.

If we changed the Default Language from German to English now, all registered user would have to override the new language settings in their profile. This will probably cause a lot of hassle.

Feature Request:
It would be nice, if the Default Language offered something like "Use Browser-Settings" in addition to the set of given languages.
{quote}
fields.summary: As a user I want JIRA to select the language respecting the browser-settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28489].
  {panel}

If @mention autocomplete is used in a field in which user name is already expanded after the cursor, it overwrites the last name instead doing the expansion.

Steps to replicate the issue.
- Write "Some text blah and some more text [~blahblah]"
- Place the cursor after blah
- Use @mention by writing for example @tuu and use dropdown menu to autocomplete it to @tuukka.ilomaki which becomes [~tuukka.ilomaki]
- The result is the text [~blahblah] at the end is overwritten

The problem occurs specifically on Internet Explorer 8. It works fine on Internet Explorer 9 and Mozilla Firefox.

*Workaround*
In some cases waiting a few seconds before selecting the user from the dropdown will prevent this issue from occurring.
fields.summary: @mention is not working properly on Internet Explorer 8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28468].
  {panel}

At current point, the mentions function in JIRA requires the fundamentals to work, which are:
* User must have the "Browse User" permission.
* The comments and/or description fields must be in the Wiki Text Renderer format.

However, if the *User email visibility* property in JIRA's General Configuration page is set to "Hidden", then this would break the mentions feature as well.

This has been highlighted as a knowledge base article here: [Mentions are Not Working in JIRA 5.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Mentions+are+Not+Working+in+JIRA+5.x]

It would be great if the mentions feature is bounded to just the user's username and full name, just like Confluence.
fields.summary: Improve Mention Function to Exclude Email Address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28466].
  {panel}

The custom field "Custom_A" whose available context is 7 issue types (not all issue types). The custom field is available for at least one of the projects

The project "Project_A" has 9 issue types, 7 of which are standard issue type (those that have the custom field "Custom_A"), and 2 that are sub-tasks.

When I do a search in the issue navigator, if I select the project "Project_A" and select some or all of the standard issue types and search, under Custom Fields there is a drop down box for "Custom_A".

However, if I select the project "Project_A" and "Standard Issue Types" the field "Custom_A" is not available. It seems that the "Standard Issue Types" option is not parsed correctly. I would expect it would "check" all standard issue types for this project. Instead it makes a check on all standard issue types on global server, causing the custom field to not pop-up as an search option.



As a work-around I've selected the custom field to be used by all issue types. Still this looks like something that needs to be resolved.
fields.summary: Missing custom field in issue navigator search criteria using the Standard Issue Types option
Plugin Data Storage table listings return tables in random order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28459].
  {panel}

CAC page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA050/__date+and+time+formats

Under *Configuring date picker formats*, on the *Preferred Date/Time* table you'll find on the second line the value of the {{jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format}} property:
* %b/%e/%y %I:%M %p

But, actually this is what was supposed to be:
* %m/%d/%y %I:%M %p

Because, according to the first table, the *MM/dd/yy* value it's equivalent to the format %m/%d/%y and not %b/%e/%y.

I have resolved an issue that the customer was following the documentation to configure his date picker and he was failed. Then, I found out that the value in the documentation were wrong. I asked him to use the right value and he was succeeded.
fields.summary: Value of the jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format property

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28443].
  {panel}

*Summary of The Issue*

As describe on this documentation:

* [Adding a Custom Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+a+Custom+Field]

When creating custom fields the following option is provided:

* Bug Import Id
* Import Id

Both of those options have the same description which is

* Bug Import Id
A read-only custom field that points back to the previously imported bug id.
* Import Id
A read-only custom field that points back to the previously imported bug id.

Although both of those options have the same description, "Bug Import Id" have one important difference which is non-searchable. 

*Suggested Resolution*

* Deleting "*Bug Import Id*" from custom fields option
* Changing the custom fields description to the following
** *Bug Import Id*
A read-only, *non-searchable* custom field that points back to the previously imported bug id.
** *Import Id*
A read-only, *searchable* custom field that points back to the previously imported bug id.
fields.summary: "Bug Import ID" is redundant compared to "Import Id"
